node.title: Parents hope inquest into killing of Hannah Clarke and her children will 'fill in a few missing pieces'
node.alt: Hannah Clarke's parents Lloyd and Sue Clarke
node.description: A pre-inquest conference in Brisbane is told the evidence relating to the brutal murder of Hannah Clarke and her children "will paint a complex picture". A two-week inquest hearing has been set down for March.
node.content:
["The parents of Brisbane woman Hannah Clarke, who was murdered alongside her three children in a family violence attack, say they hope an inquest into their deaths will uncover any \"missing pieces\" about what happened.", "Ms Clarke and her children, Aaliyah, 6, Laianah, 4 and three-year-old Trey, were killed in February last year when her estranged husband Rowan Baxter doused them in petrol and set them alight inside their car at\u00a0Camp Hill.", "The children died at the scene and the 31-year-old mother\u00a0died later\u00a0in hospital from her injuries.", "Baxter also died shortly after the attack from self-inflicted wounds.", "During a pre-inquest conference held in Brisbane, counsel assisting the coroner Jacoba Brasch told the court the inquiry was set to \"look backwards\" to identify \"warning signs\" from Baxter and examine whether appropriate actions were taken to address the threat to Ms Clarke and her children.", "\"This inquest is an opportunity to reflect upon what could have been done differently \u2014 or better \u2014 to identify the escalating risks posed by Baxter in the weeks leading to 19 February.", "\"The evidence will paint a complex picture.\"", "Ms Brasch said Baxter had been a \"highly manipulative\" husband who controlled his wife with \"threat, intimidation, guilt, shame and raw anger\", and that he had been determined to \"re-assert control\" by killing her and his children.", "\"The evidence will shine a spotlight on this form of domestic violence \u2026 which is subtle and nuanced, even imperceptible to all but the most expert eyes, yet has devastating consequences.\"", "", "
The inquest will examine the response from authorities before the murders of\u00a0Hannah Clarke and her children.(Supplied: Sue Clarke)
", "
'Innocent lives were lost'
", "Ms Brasch said Ms Clarke was known to many as \"a warm, caring, fun loving and a wonderful mother\" and described what happened to her and her children as \"indescribable horror\" and an act of \"unimaginable cruelty\".", "\"Completely innocent lives were lost.\"", "Outside court, Ms Clarke's parents Sue and Lloyd said they were happy the inquest was finally being held and were ready for it to be over.", "\"Hopefully it will fill in a few missing pieces for us,\" Mrs Clarke said.", "A two-week hearing has been set down for next March and it was expected to hear evidence from several witnesses, including first responders and family and friends of Ms\u00a0Clarke.", "It will also examine the response of police officers who investigated her complaints about Baxter, and those of other government and non-government domestic violence services who were in contact with the pair."]
